instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Noise in video <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Liquid board arround lvds. I replaced lvds connector and reflowd some areas. LVDS and screen was also damaged so I replaced LCD cable and screen too.
Now I have video but there is noise like in the image. When boot to OS X is worst (red noise). I checked lvds again and it is solder well. Any thing that I can check?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Noise in video <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Measure diode mode on all the LVDS lines at the LCD connector.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Noise in video <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I compared with working board and I found only different in pin 34 - <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL>
WORKING BOARD - 534
FAULTY BOARD - 1

I checked <RESISTOR>R9717</RESISTOR> and it is 0 ohm

threads.title: [SOLVED]Noise in video <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
LED return has nothing to do with LVDS. Bad connector soldering or bad cable.

There is also no pin 34 on a 2936 board, it's a 30 pin connector. I assume it is 24 and it seems shorted to GND, likely due to bad soldering on connector too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Noise in video <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Sorry, it is pin 24 and in my schematic it is pin 24 - <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL>
Also 1 I mean 0L - open line. Not 1ohm.

So in working board I have 400 in diode mode red in ground and in faulty board I have open line in pin 24. No conexion betwen <RESISTOR>R9717</RESISTOR> and pin24. 

Tried another screen and lcd cable assenbly and same problem. I can see red noise in screen.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Noise in video <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Could be bad PCH or CPU?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Noise in video <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Did you even read my post #4?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Noise in video <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Replaced LVDS connector again and it is ok now. Thanks
